headline: Zebra’s AI-powered 3D Sensors Save Money and Cut Waste for EBI Electric
summary: LINCOLNSHIRE, Ill., February 24, 2026--Zebra Technologies Corporation (NASDAQ: ZBRA), a global leader in digitizing and automating workflows to deliver intelligent operations, today announced that EBI Electric, an innovative wood scanning solutions provider, is using Zebra’s AltiZ 3D sensors to power its new AI-enriched lumber scanning solution, Inspector T. The new solution provides an eightfold improvement in measurement precision, enabling lumber manufacturers to reduce costly errors and wast

headline: 3 Reasons to Sell ZBRA and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Zebra has gotten torched over the last six months - since August 2025, its stock price has dropped 27.4% to $232.00 per share. This might have investors contemplating their next move.

headline: Is It Time To Reassess Zebra Technologies (ZBRA) After Prolonged Share Price Weakness?
summary: If you are wondering whether Zebra Technologies is starting to look mispriced, this article walks through what the numbers say about its current valuation. The stock closed at US$231.32, with returns of a 12.6% decline over 7 days, a 3.8% decline over 30 days and a 6.8% decline year to date, alongside a 25.3% decline over 1 year, a 21.9% decline over 3 years and a 54.8% decline over 5 years. Recent market attention has focused on Zebra Technologies in the context of its longer term share...
